comment: I had him for storyboard and composition and he was great. It was one of those long friday classes and it felt like forever but as long as you like drawing, storyboarding, and making animatics it's a fun class! For the last project you have complete creative control and it's great. Professor Wheeler is also pretty lenient and helpful as well

He was a great lecturer and you could tell he was passionate about what he was teaching. However, his quizzes and tests were extremely difficult. All of the slideshows had 40+ slides and we would be quizzed on 4-5 slideshows at a time. A quiz/test question would be based off one bulletpoint on a random slide. Otherwise a very interesting class.

Very interesting class! He's very knowledgeable and makes thing easy to understand for non-animation majors. Tests were a little hard, but I have a hard time memorizing names/dates. Overall a good experience! If you need art history credits, take this class.

Prof. Wheeler is super nice and his lectures are entertaining, although fast-paced and with often irrelevant info. Project heavy with two that require you to spend a substantial amount of time on an artwork for a non-studio class. Make sure to study for the tests and quizzes as there are usually no study guides!!

Mr.Wheeler is great! Very funny, has great lectures. You can tell he puts a lot of effort into having clear and concise lectures. There is no discussion posts or weekly homework, but he does have in class quiz/exam and some projects. No study guides, you only have his powerpoints. Make sure you study and take good notes. Start your projects EARLY!
